title: Drawing, "Ceiling Design", ca. 1727
inscribed: "Canot" in reddish brown ink center lower edge
provenance:
Collection of Léon Decloux

Ex-coll. of Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris May 19, 1896, no.43, for 92 Francs.)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The boy king, Louis XV (1710-1774) stands on a gallery accompanied by Justice and Bellona and crowned by two genii. Abundance is present as well as France, and demons appear to be fleeing the scene. Music greets the king from another gallery. Caryatids support the entablature.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Ceiling Design", ca. 1727.Watercolor, gouache, ink. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-29.
